page.title: 02Housing
page.content: There are 18 houses, 5 cottages, 4 bungalows, and 6 farmhouses that are permanently occupied; 7 of these are rented and 24 are owner occupied. There are also 2 houses that are empty and 4 that are used as holiday residences. 20 of the occupied homes have a garage, 7 have a barn and 17 have various sheds or outbuildings. Many houses appear to be more recently built than is actually the case, the fronts having been re-built whilst the interior walls and rear walls remain of very old construction. The oldest house is reputed to be Garth Cottage. Craiglea has the date 1733 on some internal woodwork.
